result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Eckerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

6 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation
Concurrent with: 21CF713

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with co-defendant, Shelby Peterson
No contact with L.B. or any RCU location

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William R Eckerman

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

2:17 PM Cases called; 21CF713 & 22CF777. Defendant William R Eckerman in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for William R Eckerman.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. The parties have an agreement. 

22CF777 - Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 in 21CF713: Uttering a Forgery as a Party to a Crime, as a Repeater. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1in 22CF777: Possession of Methamphetamine as a Repeater.
Priors related to these counts are acknowledged. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders 2 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions, each count concurrent. 
Conditions of Probation:
90 days jail in 22CF777 only, all stayed pending further order of the court - Huber or electronic monitoring as jail deems him eligible.
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with co-defendant, Shelby Peterson
No contact with L.B. or any RCU location
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
court costs and surcharges

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. 
8 days of jail credit if revoked in 21CF713
6 days of jail credit if revoked in 22CF777

Cases called at 11:34 AM: 217CF713, 22CF777. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant William R Eckerman in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson appeared by video for William R Eckerman.  Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants quashed. Branch 2 ordered a $2,000 Cash Bond yesterday when the Defendant failed to appear at the Final STC before a Jury Trial.
Court orders $2,000 Cash Bond to cover both cases.
22CF777: Preliminary Hearing: 9/13/22 at 2:30 PM with 21CF713 to ride along.
21CF713: Branch 2 to schedule further proceedings.

Cases called at 11:07 AM: 21CF713, 22CF777.
Defendant William R Eckerman not in court.   Attorney Erika Amundson in court for William R Eckerman.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Amundson has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. 
Court removes the Jury Trial in 21CF713 from the calendar and orders a $2,000 Cash Bond when the Defendant is picked up.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(Case called at 11:59 AM) Defendant William R Eckerman not in court.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State indicates the Defendant has another open case with dates.
